channel.title: Empty map = noisy PC fan?
channel.description:
I can play Black Mesa without any problems on the highest settings and my system surpass the system requirements. But after playing aound a bit with the hammer editor and testing a map ingame, I noticed that my pc fan starts to spin very loud. I just created a small empty room with nothing inside. Also modifying the graphics settings changed nothing. Is this a normal behavior?
I've tested the map in other source games like Half-Life 2 and there this issue doesn't occur.

item.title: Empty map = noisy PC fan?
item.dc:creator: Johnwalter
item.description:
Modding beginner here.
I’d say that something on the map is causing your GPU to heat up quickly, so it has to spin it’s fans faster to keep cool.
I don’t know Hammer at all, but try to make the same thing from scratch. And keep track of what you’ve done to make the map.
Find the source of the problem.
